H0.text: Which is the only element, from the group known as the Halogens, which is liquid at room temperature. Fluorine

H1.text: Which is the only element, from the group known as the Halogens, which is liquid at room temperature. Chlorine

H2.text: Which is the only element, from the group known as the Halogens, which is liquid at room temperature. Iodine

H3.text: Which is the only element, from the group known as the Halogens, which is liquid at room temperature. Bromeen

A4.text: At standard conditions for temperature and pressure it is a liquid; the only other element that is liquid under these conditions is mercury.

A5.text: Fluorine is a very pale yellow gas.
